posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
I seem to recall that the Initiative Feats didn't work in early releases of the game.  Has that been addressed in DE or EE?  Also, I recall once reading that Initiative is tied to DEX - is that true?

All of which leads to - is there a way to make a build that almost always gets in the 1st strike?

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
I've not tested this in NWN:EE, but I also don't recall ever hearing that Beamdog fixed anything with initiative. I wish they did...I'd most likely be actually investing in initiative improving feats...

The wiki link
https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Initiative

shows all the modifiers.

I actually think it is more broken than that wiki suggests. My thoughts stem from playing on a perma death modern zombie survival server, where even when I attacked out of stealth a dex 8 zombie, one shotting it, they would often enough actually hit me before they died...

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I think there is a bit of confusion here.

Initiative allows you to go first - but in NWN, it does not mean that others do not get their attacks in that flurry.

The exception to this could be Death Attack - I am pretty sure it paralyzes instantly (seem that way to me).

I am not sure about the rest of the attacks (flurries) in the round (if, for example, a dev crit occurs, or death, etc).

posts.author: Ten Pura
posts.content:
Hail Theophilus Fist!
I believe that when you're seeking a character that strikes first, you'll find a ranged sneaker.

Another option, break your (extended) Improved Invisibility with Time Stop. Follow with Bigby's. Summon something. Pitch tent, sip chilled drinks and relax.

In all seriousness, if I want to strike first, I don't melee.

I don't always melee, but when I do, I prefer Mestil's.

I'll show myself out now...
